channel.title: Python IDE
channel.description: Which IDE is 'the best' for using with python? Or should I just stick to the terminal?

item.title: Python IDE
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:

item.title: Python IDE
item.dc:creator: @zstars zstars
item.description:
@zstars wrote:

Yeah, I am aware. I like Python, that is why I think it is a pity that its IDEs are so bad. Python is a powerful scripting language, which tends to increase productivity, but at the same time, lacking IDEs tend to decrease it.

Read full topic

item.title: Python IDE
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“zstars, post:18, topic:265161”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=350103.msg2692041#msg2692041 date=1236026456]
go suck microsofts dick elsewhere
[/quote]

I don’t suck dicks. Nothing’s lost for you though, because even if I did I couldn’t find yours without a microscope

On any case, not talking especifically about Microsoft. Even Java Eclipse (not PyDev), code::blocks, Netbeans, Borland C++ / Borland Delphi are good compared to most free Python IDEs.[/quote]quite an amout of nerdrage in ya

are you aware that python is generally used as a scripting language?

item.title: Python IDE
item.dc:creator: @zstars zstars
item.description:
@zstars wrote:

Shut up yourself, retard. I’m not your ED teacher. If an entity sucks, then you are comparing that entity to another. Comparing something to itself is pointless. If your brain sucks probably so do your math skills, but a/a (a being non-null) == 1 for a reason.

Python free IDEs suck because other languages’ free IDEs don’t. Even Forrest Gump could grasp that.

Read full topic

item.title: Python IDE
item.dc:creator: @nG_Krypton nG Krypton
item.description:
@nG_Krypton wrote:

[quote=“zstars, post:14, topic:265161”][quote author=nG Krypton link=topic=350103.msg2691862#msg2691862 date=1236020520]

All free python IDEs suck hard.

Bullshit post is bullshit.

Bullshit post about bullshit post is bullshit. Please compare a modern IDE such as Visual Studio Team System’s C#, with full syntax highlightning, full code completion, object viewer, multi project support, integrated debugger, object test bench, test cases, memory profiling, code profiling, to your favourite free python IDE.

All free python IDEs suck hard. “Best” ones I’ve tried are Boa Constructor and PyDev. Lately I’ve been using Boa Constructor.

Did I once mention C#?
[/quote]

No, I did. Python free IDEs suck hard, C# IDEs don’t.[/quote]

The fuck is that even a valid point anyway? We were on the topic of Python IDE’s and them supposedly sucking if they’re free. Shut the fuck up moron.

Read full topic

item.title: Python IDE
item.dc:creator: @zstars zstars
item.description:

[quote=“nG Krypton, post:11, topic:265161”][quote author=zstars link=topic=350103.msg2691647#msg2691647 date=1236012939]
All free python IDEs suck hard.

Please compare a modern IDE such as Visual Studio Team System’s C#, with full syntax highlightning, full code completion, object viewer, multi project support, integrated debugger, object test bench, test cases, memory profiling, code profiling, to your favourite free python IDE.

Or compare the Express edition one, which is free, and has most of the above features except profiling.

kkty

item.title: Python IDE
item.dc:creator: @nG_Krypton nG Krypton
item.description:
@nG_Krypton wrote:

[quote=“atrox_, post:8, topic:265161”][quote author=nG Krypton link=topic=350103.msg2691359#msg2691359 date=1235993742]

what is wrong with idle?

Nothing, but if you want something “heavier”, then why not choose SPE (Stani’s Python Editor) or Eric4.
[/quote]

I tried Eric, but for some weird reason it closed itself every other minute.[/quote]

Try SPE, it’s lacking a few of the more advanced features Eric has but, it’s still sufficient for progressing at a decent speed. Plus it’s written in Python

Read full topic

item.description:
@atrox wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:2, topic:265161”]Your text editor of choice is fine, be that vim, emacs, nano or notepad++ (or whatever)

If you really want a full IDE, youve got eclipse, eric or Wing.[/quote]
Eclipse is a python IDE? I never knew that, thanks.
